snippet: In an era when digital effects have made the use of small models and suited actors look quaint, tokusatsu, or “special filming,” is on the way out.
abstract: Japanese monster film genre known as tokusatsu or special filming, which features actors in rubber suits laying waste to scaled-down models, is rapidly becoming thing of the past in era of lifelike digital effects; Shinji Higuchi, one of few directors left who still has experience in genre, has organized exhibit on history of tokusatsu in effort to revive or at least chronicle it for younger generations.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: In an era when digital effects have made the use of small models and suited actors look quaint, tokusatsu, or “special filming,” is on the way out.

headline.main: Rubber-Suit Monsters Fade. Tiny Tokyos Relax.
headline.print_headline: Rubber-Suit Monsters Fade. Tiny Tokyos Relax.
